place.name: STRAGGLETHORPE
place.gazetteerText: STRAGGLETHORPE, a parish in the district of Newark and county of Lincoln; 4 miles NE of Claypole r. station, and 7¼ E by S of Newark. Post town, Newark. Acres, 1,150. Real property, £1,409. Pop., 90. Houses, 18. The manor belongs to Sir G. E. Welby, Bart. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to Beckingham. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
